segment.source: Using Windows PowerShell to Administer MBAM 2.5
segment.target: Using Windows PowerShell to Administer MBAM 2.5

segment.source: Using Windows PowerShell to Administer MBAM 2.5
segment.target: Using Windows PowerShell to Administer MBAM 2.5

segment.source: Using Windows PowerShell to Administer MBAM 2.5
segment.target: Using Windows PowerShell to Administer MBAM 2.5

segment.source: This topic describes Windows PowerShell cmdlets for Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) that relate to recovering computers or drives when users get locked out.
segment.target: This topic describes Windows PowerShell cmdlets for Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) that relate to recovering computers or drives when users get locked out.

segment.source: For cmdlets that you use to configure MBAM Server features, see Configuring MBAM 2.5 Server Features by Using Windows PowerShell.
segment.target: For cmdlets that you use to configure MBAM Server features, see Configuring MBAM 2.5 Server Features by Using Windows PowerShell.

segment.source: Cmdlets for recovering computers or drives that are managed by MBAM
segment.target: Cmdlets for recovering computers or drives that are managed by MBAM

segment.source: Use the following Windows PowerShell cmdlets to recover computers or drives that are managed by MBAM.
segment.target: Use the following Windows PowerShell cmdlets to recover computers or drives that are managed by MBAM.

segment.source: Name
segment.target: Name

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Get-MbamBitLockerRecoveryKey
segment.target: Get-MbamBitLockerRecoveryKey

segment.source: Requests an MBAM recovery key that enables users to unlock a computer or encrypted drive.
segment.target: Requests an MBAM recovery key that enables users to unlock a computer or encrypted drive.

segment.source: Get-MbamTPMOwnerPassword
segment.target: Get-MbamTPMOwnerPassword

segment.source: Provides users with a TPM owner password that they can use to unlock a Trusted Platform Module (TPM) when the TPM has locked them out and will no longer accept their PIN.
segment.target: Provides users with a TPM owner password that they can use to unlock a Trusted Platform Module (TPM) when the TPM has locked them out and will no longer accept their PIN.

segment.source: MBAM cmdlet Help
segment.target: MBAM cmdlet Help

segment.source: Windows PowerShell Help for MBAM cmdlets is available in the following formats:
segment.target: Windows PowerShell Help for MBAM cmdlets is available in the following formats:

segment.source: Windows PowerShell Help format
segment.target: Windows PowerShell Help format

segment.source: More information
segment.target: More information

segment.source: At a Windows PowerShell command prompt, type Get-Helpcmdlet
segment.target: At a Windows PowerShell command prompt, type Get-Helpcmdlet

segment.source: To upload the latest Windows PowerShell cmdlets, follow the instructions in Configuring MBAM 2.5 Server Features by Using Windows PowerShell
segment.target: To upload the latest Windows PowerShell cmdlets, follow the instructions in Configuring MBAM 2.5 Server Features by Using Windows PowerShell
